meanings.definition: The quality or state of being recursive.
meanings.sent1: The recursivenesses of the pattern made it easy to predict the next shape.
meanings.sent2: Her essay on the recursivenesses of language was insightful and well-researched.
meanings.sent3: The recursivenesses of the mirror maze confused the visitors, making them walk in circles.
meanings.sent4: The recursivenesses of the story within a story added depth to the novel.
meanings.sent5: The artist used recursivenesses in his painting to create a sense of infinity.

meanings.definition: The act or process of repeating or returning.
meanings.sent1: The recursivenesses of the melody in the song made it catchy and memorable.
meanings.sent2: The recursivenesses of the algorithm allowed the program to solve complex problems efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The recursivenesses of the joke had everyone laughing as it kept coming back around.
meanings.sent4: The recursivenesses of the river flowing back to its source symbolized the cycle of life.
meanings.sent5: The recursivenesses of the dance routine impressed the audience with its seamless transitions.
